dataIdInfo.idPurp: The purpose is to provide general farms information for the Mexican portion of the Rio Grande/Río Bravo basin. This layer is part of a socio-environmental geodatabase that aims to provide an easy access to transboundary information for the Rio Grande/Río Bravo basin. This dataset can be used in a geographic information system (GIS) or for other geographic applications.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This vector data depicts the number of farm and farm areas for the municipios of the Mexican portion of the Rio Grande/Río Bravo basin in 2007.

The dataset includes the following variables: total number of farms, total farms area, average size of farms, number of farms with farming/forestry activities, areas with farming/forestry activities, number of farms without farming/forestry activities, corresponding without farming/forestry activities. Areas are calculated in hectares. See Entity and Attribute Information for a detailed list of variables.

This vector data was created from the Mexican Census of agriculture (Censo Agrícola, Ganadero y Forestal 2007), produced by INEGI. Data relative to number and area of farms are accessible in the table “1.1.Número y superficie total de unidades de producción según desarrollen o no actividad agropecuaria o forestal”.

To generate the vector data for the Mexican portion of the Rio Grande/Río Bravo basin, we joined the census data with the layer of Municipios provided in this geodatabase. Data processing steps are detailed in the section Data Quality Information>Lineage.
dataIdInfo.idCredit:
Geodatabase compilation: Plassin, S., Koch, J., Paladino, S., Friedman, J. R., Spencer, K., Vaché, K. B., 2019. Geospatial data for the Rio Grande/Río Bravo socio-environmental system. Open Science Framework. https://doi.org/10.17605/OSF.IO/79426.
Data Source: • Census of Agriculture INEGI. Censo Agrícola, Ganadero y Forestal 2007. Retrieved on June 23 2017, from: https://www.inegi.org.mx/programas/cagf/2007/default.html
• Municipios boundaries Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía (INEGI). 2016 Marco Geoestadístico. Retrieved on April 10 2017, from: http://www.beta.inegi.org.mx/app/biblioteca/ficha.html?upc=702825217341

Consts.useLimit:
This dataset is a derivative outcome from the Censo Agrícola, Ganadero y Forestal2007, produced by the Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía (INEGI). The original data provider has not evaluated the data as altered and incorporated in the geodatabase, and therefore gives no warranty regarding its accuracy, completeness, currency or suitability for any particular purpose. The user shall assume all risk of using the information.

Terms of use of the INEGI datasets: The data provided by INEGI are in the public domain. However, the Instituto Nacional de Estadística, Geografía e Informática (INEGI) assumes no liability for any damages that may result to any user as a direct or indirect result of any decision or action taken or not taken, based in whole or in part on use of the information. In case of data reproduction, users must give appropriate credit to INEGI, provides a link to the data source (https://www.inegi.org.mx/) and the date of access to the data.

dataSource.srcDesc:
• Census of Agriculture INEGI. Censo Agrícola, Ganadero y Forestal 2007. Retrieved on June 23 2017, from: https://www.inegi.org.mx/programas/cagf/2007/default.html
• Municipios boundaries Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía (INEGI). 2016 Marco Geoestadístico. Retrieved on April 10 2017, from: http://www.beta.inegi.org.mx/app/biblioteca/ficha.html?upc=702825217341

prcStep.stepDesc:
We imported the raw dataset “1.1. Número y superficie total de unidades de producción según desarrollen o no actividad agropecuaria o forestal” (cag_2007_01) as a csv file.
This dataset provides for municipio: the number of farms (unidades de producción), the total area (superficie total), the number of farms and the corresponding area with a farming or forestry activity (con actividad agropecuaria o forestal total), and the number of farms and the corresponding area without a farming or forestry activity (sin actividad agropecuaria o forestal total),
To be able to join the spatial layer of Municipios boundaries with the Census dataset, we performed preliminary cleaning operations with Excel in the excel tables: (1) Organize the data in a data frame readable for ArcGIS (one variable per column, one municipio per row). (2) Select the rows for the area of interest (municipios in Coahuila de Zaragoza, Chihuahua, Durango, Nuevo Leon and Tamaulipas) and delete the others. (3) Translate from Spanish to English the fields names. (4) Add a new column GEOID and report the unique 5-digit ID number of each municipio.
The following steps were then performed using ESRI’s ArcGIS 10.6: (1) Join the excel file to the Counties_and_municipios shapefile using the tool Join based on the unique ID of each municipio. (2) Remove duplicate fields.
